column4: PLEASE can someone with a windows dual-boot system paste me his GRUB lines to boot the windows partition? breezy wiped them out here...
why do you say that breezy wiped them out?
because it worked fine, then it upgraded the kernel, i rebooted and windows was out of the grub menu
upgrading the kernel only adds a new kernel to the menu
it doesnt
really, I mean it
hoary or breezy?
and i really mean that breezy wiped my fucking windows boot entry out of grub each time i upgraded the kernel, i always had to add windows manually via the system\administration\boot tool
please watch your language
breezxy
that's not normal operation.
was the windows partition detected during install?  If not, when you added it, did you run update-grub?
yes it was detected during install
then on the first kernel upgrade i did it got away
sounds fishy
i had to add windows each time after an upgrade via that panel that is now gone
perhaps that gui you used altered grubs behavior, because windows should not ever have been deleted from the list
might be, i used that tool to set windows xp as default partition
and if you ever manually edit /boot/grub/menu.lst, always be sure to run "sudo update-grub" after
probably it messed up something
now that I'd believe
